title: Economic growth - increase in aggregate supply

content.question: Which of the following statements concerning economic growth is true?

choices.label: If the population is growing faster than potential output, real gross domestic product per capita will definitely increase.
With long-run economic growth, there is an increase in aggregate supply.
The gap between rich and poor must widen with long-run economic growth.
Increasing potential output necessarily increases the economic welfare of the average citizen.
Long-run economic growth is only possible with demand management policies.

content.answer: With long-run economic growth, there is an increase in aggregate supply.
